subject: RE: [junit] How to aggregate differences instead of asserting just the first difference ?
msgSnippet: ... Sounds to me like you want to compare two files, and not rows - in a similar way that assertEquals for Strings doesn t just fail on the first difference in
messageBody:
> For example, if I will parse two files and compare row by row, I
> would like to see all the differences and not just the first
> difference.

Sounds to me like you want to compare two files, and not rows - in a similar
way that assertEquals for Strings doesn't just fail on the first difference
in a character.

With other words, what you probably want to do/look for, is an assert method
that gathers all differences in two files and then fails with an appropriate
message if there are any.

Does that sound reasonable?

Cheers, Ilja
